listing.description: Built and designed by the current owners Foxgrove built in 2014 offers accommodation approaching 10,000 sq ft. With an equally large specification.An impressive marble floored entrance hall features a bespoke oak turned staircase double height with skylight and access to all the principle reception rooms. These include a drawing room, dining room and comprehensively fitted study with furniture by Chambers in Oak and burr oak.The family room merges into the contemporary state of the art Chambers fitted kitchen with Gaggenau appliances and a neat concealed access to a separate utility room.An amazing games room/entertainment room with bar and trophy cabinet provides excellent aspects through a floor to ceiling glass wall over the indoor pool, which has a spa and steam room alongside the usual shower and changing facilities.Six bedroom suites occupy the first and second floors, all fully fitted with quality sanitaryware and fitted furniture.The attractive elevations include quality double gazed sash windows providing that traditional much sought after look.With underfloor heating, technology and mood lighting this bright and spacious residence sits on a plot of half an acre within this popular gated estate.Keston Park itself sits on the edge of green belt countryside. A private estate with access to the M25 at junction 4 and 20 minutes from London bridge via Orpington Station.Family Entrance Hall Double doors to front, marble floor, feature staircase, atrium, cornice, low voltage lighting, oak built-in cloaks cupboard, underfloor heating, lighting control panels, access to integral double garage, door to:Cloakroom With contemporary suite, free standing wash hand basin with wash stand and mixer tap, low level WC with concealed cistern, porcelain tiled floor, tiling to walls, double glazed opaque window to side, underfloor heating, cornice, low voltage lightingDrawing Room Feature stone fireplace surround, contemporary grate with coal effect gas fire, provision for wall mounted TV, ceiling speakers, lighting control panels, surround sound, low voltage lighting, dual aspect sash windows to side, feature bay window and double doors with aspect and access to gardens to rear, underfloor heating, full height oak double glazed doors to hallwayDining Room Oak double doors from hall, underfloor heating, lighting control panel, av control panel, cornice, ceiling speakers, low voltage lighting, underfloor heating, feature bay window to front with double glazed sash windows.Study Bespoke fitted by Chambers with oak and burr oak furniture, smoked glass top with cabinets and drawers, free standing desk in oak and burr oak with smoked glass top, oak floor, built-in cabinet with TV, feature bay window to front with double glazed sash windows, cornice, ceiling speaker fittings. listing.description: Milestones is a large high specification residence completed in 2009. Positioned on the edge of Keston Park close to Locksbottom Village. Offering extensive accommodation approaching 11,000 sq ft. The property boasts a wealth of quality, beautifully fitted with oak joinery, Lutron lighting and an impressive galleried hall/landing with bespoke oak staircase and marble floors. The spacious accommodation includes five reception rooms with bespoke fitted furniture in the study and kitchen by Chambers Furniture. The property has been finished in a contemporary traditional style with feature fireplaces, underfloor heating and oak framed double glazed windows. Upstairs there are seven bedroom suites over two floors, the master suite taking one wing of the house. In addition there is a triple detached garage block with staff annexe over. The property sits central on its one acre plot with a large gated gravel driveway and access to south easterly facing gardens to rear with a large terrace. An early viewing is thoroughly recommended.Entrance Porch With Tudor arch to front.Entrance Hall With bespoke Tudor arched oak door and surround to front with double glazed windows, bespoke oak listing.description: Ravensbourne is an historic Manor House positioned alongside Keston Ponds, in extensive private grounds.The house and grounds have been thoughtfully transformed into seven luxury manor apartments and four townhouses.The apartments and houses all feature wonderful private outdoor terraces and garden space as well as dedicated underground parking, with over 14,000 sq ft of private amenity for the owners in addition to nearly 3 acres of gardens. Being designed with the utmost care, the apartments benefit from a superb specification such as bespoke kitchens with marble work surfaces, bespoke bathrooms and ensuites and underfloor heating throughout.The development benefits from a secure "Club Room", containing a boot room, dog wash facility and storage. Visitor car spaces are situated towards the front of the grounds. Security has been well considered with CCTV, Video entry and number plate recognition system to the front gate.Locally, the area is extremely popular offering a 17 minute train journey to London Victoria from Bromley South. With Hayes and Orpington stations only a few miles away, fast trains are available to Cannon Street, Charing Cross as well as Victoria. The Keston Ponds location is highly sought after, being surrounded by quiet, tree lined roads, large detached properties and the private gated estates of Keston Park and Farnborough Park. The village of Keston boasts a post office, several village shops and three popular pubs. Keston Common is popular for dog walking and the surrounding area benefits from several golf courses. Several poipular schools are situated in the wider local area.

listing.letting_fees: Tenant administration fees will be charged at a cost of £200 + vat for up to two people. Each additional person will be charged at £60 + vat. If a guarantor is required there will be an additional charge of £60 + vat
listing.description: Modernised and updated to an extremely high standard is this stunning five bedroom detached residence situated in Hayes' most desirable private roads, surrounded by peaceful woodland. The accommodation comprises of a spacious entrance hall with feature glazed staircase and both family room and lounge with bi-folding doors bringing the stunning garden and decking area seamlessly into the property. There is a well appointed kitchen with numerous integrated appliances, solid work surfaces and central island opening directly onto the dining room with roof lantern proving excellent natural light and bi-folding across the full width of the room. The ground floor also features a study/office, utility room and downstairs cloakroom. The integral garage can also be accessed from the utility room. The first floor begins from the galleried landing with matching glazed balustrade, which leads to the bedrooms. The master bedroom provides a stunning vista over the rear garden from the bi-folding doors and Juliet balcony and features an en-suite bathroom and an ample range of fitted wardrobes. Bedrooms two and three are en-suite to a luxury Jack and Jill bathroom. There are two further bedrooms and a further luxury family bathroom. The rear garden is a particular feature of the plot being laid to lawn and stocked with a lovely mix of mature trees and shrubs, not overlooked from the rear and having a substantial deck patio area. To the front there is a horseshoe driveway with parking for numerous vehicles and an additional garden area opposite leading into the woodland and a feature of the road. Hayes Station (London zone 5) is within 0.7 miles offering direct services into London Bridge, Charing Cross and Cannon Street. The highly regarded Hayes Secondary School is just 0.25 miles away, currently rated outstanding by Ofsted and recently recognised as being in the top 100 state secondary schools in UK. listing.description: The largest penthouse apartment extending to over 2700 sq ft. With superb views over beautifully tended gardens including a magnificent natural lake, located within the unique Keston Waterside gated development is one of eight individually designed properties. Less than 15 miles from central London, all accommodation has been sympathetically crafted from a Victorian red brick villa. This penthouse apartment has well-proportioned interiors finished to a superior design specification, and includes three good size bedrooms, all with en suites. Double doors lead to two west facing balconies - which are accessed from the lounge and kitchen to provide a great space in which to relax and also entertain. In addition, the roof terrace offers private space to enjoy the good weather. With Orpington train station 1.8 miles from the property, offering fast services into London and Locksbottom Village under half a mile, this apartment must be viewed to be truly appreciated

listing.description: A very attractive character, 1930s built 4/5 bedroom house backing onto the Keston Park Estate, within close proximity of the popular Keston woodlands and ponds. Set behind electric gates, this well presented family home has three spacious reception rooms along with a modern fitted kitchen, two bathrooms (including an en suite) and conservatory. The property features double glazing throughout, an attached garage and lovely gardens with south east aspect and garden summer house, complete with power. The ever popular Keston primary school is close by, as is Ravenswood School. It is also well located for the local grammars and the nearby private schools.

listing.letting_fees:
Once we have agreed terms for a tenancy, we will require payment of a non-refundable £175 tenancy administration fee per tenant (each adult to be resident in the property), covering all referencing, preparation of the tenancy agreement and associated administration relating to commencement of tenancy, together with a £200 reservation fee which will be credited to your initial rental on commencement of tenancy

A deposit will be due on commencement of tenancy, calculated at 125% (1 & 1/4 times) the monthly rent, unless an additional amount is agreed, for example in relation to pets. This is to be held for the duration of tenancy and from which deduction may be made based on the findings of the inventory check-out or otherwise in respect of breach of contract.

A landlord will normally pay to have an inventory prepared and checked on commencement of tenancy, whilst a tenant will normally pay for an inventory check-out on termination of tenancy, currently typically between £70 - £110 dependent on size of property and subject to change over time.

We currently charge tenants £60 to prepare a tenancy agreement on renewal of tenancy, usually annually. This is subject to change over time.
listing.description: This delightful four/five bedroom detached house is situated in the heart of Bickley with excellent access to local amenities and rail links from Bickley station into central London.The house itself is extremely well presented and offers both flexible and spacious accommodation.The ground floor has so many features including an attractive entrance hallway with Amtico floor, large living room with views over the rear garden, dining room and a TV Room which can be used as the fifth bedroom as it has an en-suite shower room. The breakfasting/kitchen is a very good size with granite work surfaces and a central island. There is also a separate utility room.Upstairs the four main bedrooms radiate from the feature landing. The master bedroom boasts both an en-suite bathroom and a dressing room. The second bedroom also has the flexibility to become a suite whenever is appropriate as it has a door enabling the main family bathroom to become a further en-suite. Bedrooms three and four are both good sizes and complete the first floor accommodation.Outside to the rear is a beautiful garden which is attractively laid out and is southerly facing. The patio, with gazebo, leads on to the main lawn and is a place to enjoy the sunny days.There is a large single integral garage.We strongly recommend an internal viewing of this charming house.
listing.short_description: This delightful 4/5 bedroom detached house is situated in the heart of Bickley with excellent access to local amenities and rail links from Bickley station into central London. The house itself is extremely well presented and offers both flexible and spacious accommodation.

listing.description: There are some homes, that from the moment you step inside, you feel that you are about to see something special. This 6 bedroom early Victorian home is one such home.There is character and charm from the moment you approach the home and admire the stained glass entrance door. The current owners have transformed this home into the wonderful home it is today. To blend modern contemporary features and decor whilst still retaining character and charm in an older house is an art to do well but as you continue to look around you cannot help being impressed with what has been achieved here.The home not only has its beauty but is functional too. As a family home you could not wish for more with so many reception rooms to utilise and such great sized bedrooms.Downstairs you have a choice of 4 reception rooms. There is a large Dining Room that feels bigger due to the high ceilings and arch bay window to the front. It is conveniently positioned off of the beautifully appointed Kitchen. The white units and black galaxy marble work tops add that touch of modern that all will love. If you have older children then they will probably want to adopt the Sitting Room as their own for when friends visit or would be great as a large Family Room. The larger rear Lounge is probably where the whole family can congregate of an evening to relax in front of the T.V or catch up on the day's events. Having bi-fold doors that open the Lounge into the Conservatory and then out into the garden makes this an ideal layout for entertaining a large group of friends and family. The number and size of the rooms downstairs will certainly impress you and everyone will have their own ideas on how to utilise them. The final part of the downstairs is a separate Utility Room and W.C, important for any busy family home.Upstairs is as equally impressive. There should not be any problems on room allocations here as there are 5 excellent sized double bedrooms and a reasonable sized single that could always be a study if you wished. The Master Bedroom has its own En-suite that is big enough to hold its own bath as well as shower cubicle. The other 3 bedrooms on this level then have use of the family bathroom whilst the 2 bedrooms on the upper floor have use of their own Shower Room.Outside are gardens for the whole family to enjoy. There is a patio area to enjoy al-fresco dining or just to relax on. The garden is virtually maintenance free having a synthetic lawn. No need for cutting and ideal for the children to use all year round. If you work from home, want space to pursue a hobby or just want somewhere sheltered to relax in then the Log Cabin has a multitude of uses.The location is the last benefit that will make this home so popular. For commuting you will enjoy the convenience of having Bromley South less than a mile away which has a journey time of 15 minutes into Victoria. The renowned Raglands primary School is less than a quarter mile away making the school run a 5 minute walk even for little legs. For walking the dog or going for a run you have the choice of Bromley Common or Norman Park Recreation Ground, both of which are again a walk away.Entrance HallwaySitting Room15'5" (4.70m) into bay x 12'5" (3.78m)Dining Room15'9" (4.80m) x 12'4" (3.76m)Lounge24'11" (7.59m) x 12'5" (3.78m)Conservatory11'6" (3.51m) x 9'8" (2.95m)Kitchen12'6" (3.81m) x 12'3" (3.73m) with further recess of 5'5" (1.65m)Utility Room7'10" (2.39m) x 5'3" (1.60m)CloakroomFirst FloorMaster Bedroom15'11" (4.85m) x 12'2" (3.71m)En-Suite for Master bedroomBedroom 215'11" (4.85m) x 12'2" (3.71m)Bedroom 313'1" (3.99m) x 9'11" (3.02m)Bedroom 412'3" (3.73m) x 6'6" (1.98m)Family Bathroom8'1" (2.46m) x 5'4" (1.63m)Second FloorBedroom 516'6" (5.03m) x 10'4" (3.15m)Bedroom 616'9" (5.11m) x 8'4" (2.54m)Shower RoomOutsideDriveway to front for 2-3 cars.Rear garden with patio and synthetic grass leading to:Log Cabin with Attached Shed19'8" (5.99m) x 10'9" (3.28m)

The property boasts large entrance hall, three reception rooms, kitchen/breakfast room, utility room and ground floor WC. To the first floor there are five generous bedrooms two with en suite bathrooms and a family bathroom. Other benefits include double garage, walled garden and off-street parking for several cars.The property is located in the heart of Keston Village with local amenities with local amenities that include two pubs, restaurants, local deli and post office. The property is also located within the catchment area to good schools including Keston Primary as well as Ravensbourne. Bromley South, Orpington and Hayes mainline stations offer fast links to London.

listing.description: Located approximately 15 minutes walk from Bromley South Railway Station, this delightful 6 Bedroom, 3 Bathroom, Double Fronted Detached Family Home built circa.1920, offering some 2350 sq ft of accommodation.In our opinion, this property is ideally suited to the growing or established family or for those who work from home or care for relatives, such is the volume of living space on offer.For those with a need to commute, Bromley South offers fast rail services into Central London and the West End via London Victoria or The City via London Blackfriars and Thameslink and is just a few minutes drive from the A21 Hastings Road, providing access to the M25 with links to Bluewater and Gatwick Airport.Sport and fitness enthusiasts will find the Pavilion Leisure Centre and several gymnasiums nearby including Virgin Leisure and Nuffield on Hayes Lane. Langley Park Golf course, Bromley Football Club, local cricket and tennis clubs can be found nearby.With well over 400 retail units to choose from, Bromley is one of the most extensive shopping centres in the region. The intu Shopping Centre boasts over 130 stores alone. For those with children, the property is accessible to a number of local schools including Ravensbourne Secondary, Pickhurst Infants and Juniors and Hayes Primary and Secondary.Set over 3 floors this property boasts all of the charm and character associated with properties of this era including feature fireplaces, oak parquet flooring and picture rails.To the front the property features and In and Out Driveway with ample off street parking and boasts a delightful 120’ westerly facing rear Garden with paved patio, running water features, floodlit lighting, lawned areas and borders with a large variety of mature trees and shrubs.The Entrance Hall leads to exceptionally spacious and separate Living and Dining Rooms and to the rear the property features a superb Country style Kitchen / Breakfast Room with range cooker and a number of matching wall and base units. Also located on the ground floor is a separate Utility Room with WC.The Living Room leads to the delightful Conservatory overlooking the rear garden. The first floor features 4 Double Bedrooms with 2 en suite shower rooms and separate Family Bathroom. The second floor offers 2 further double bedrooms with separate WC.Further features include gas central heating, double glazing, in built wardrobes and storage cupboards, a well proportioned loft space and an array of other features which must be viewed to be fully appreciated.Living Room6.36m x 3.85m (20' 10" x 12' 8")Dining Room4.88m x 3.85m (16' x 12' 8")Kitchen6.72m x 3.84m (22' 1" x 12' 7")Bedroom (Master)4.94m x 3.80m (16' 2" x 12' 6")En Suite2.43m x 2.30m (8' x 7' 7")Bedroom 24.25m x 3.83m (13' 11" x 12' 7")En Suite1.89m x 1.24m (6' 2" x 4' 1")Bedroom 33.97m x 2.97m (13' x 9' 9")Bedroom 43.86m x 2.87m (12' 8" x 9' 5")Bedroom 53.85m x 3.39m (12' 8" x 11' 1")Bedroom 63.69m x 3.49m (12' 1" x 11' 5")Bathroom2.82m x 2.36m (9' 3" x 7' 9")Conservatory4.52m x 4.16m (14' 10" x 13' 8")

From the large entrance hallway, the downstairs accommodation is spacious and well thought out. There is a formal sitting room, a large living/family room with a separate dining area, a good sized modern kitchen with feature stained glass window plus a utility/breakfast room.To the first floor are three double bedrooms plus an sumptuous and oversized bathroom specifically designed for the current owners featuring two wash basins, a large walk in shower and a freestanding period style bath.This stylish property is enhanced by many features including window shutters, wood floors, feature fireplaces and bi-fold doors to the garden.The rear garden measures 100'11 x 37'4 and is landscaped with a large paved patio area and lawn with mature shrub and tree borders. The accommodation which is arranged over three floors comprises to the ground floor: Enticing entrance hall featuring mosaic tiles, lounge, spacious open planned modern fitted kitchen with limestone flooring along with an aga which takes centre stage and a dining area with a skylight and tri-folding doors that bring the outside in. The ground floor also boasts two further reception rooms and a cloakroom. After climbing the staircase you arrive at the first floor which consists of the master bedroom with en-suite shower room and dressing room, two further bedrooms, a modern bathroom and a utility room. The remaining bedroom is found in the converted loft room on the second floor and has an en-suite bathroom. Outside there is ample off street parking to the front and an extensive garden to the rear with an outbuilding containing a W/C and storage. This versatile family home could soon be yours, so don't delay. Call Choices now and arrange your appointment to view, you won't be disappointed! listing.short_description:

Offering generous accommodation throughout the property comprises large entrance hall, two 17' plus reception rooms, kitchen breakfast room with Schuller fitted kitchen, split level landing family bathroom with separate shower cubicle, shower room, five double bedrooms, To the exterior is a 135' rear garden, integral garage and driveway to front providing off street parking. This fine family home demands an early viewing.

Hardwood front door with opaque glazed insert and opaque glazed leads light windows to either side. Plate rail, radiator and under stair storage cupboard.

Wall mounted 42' Samsung television, down lights and tiled floor.

listing.description: Located in one of Bickley's most sought after locations is this exceptionally spacious four double bedroom detached house which has undergone full renovation throughout. The accommodation now features a welcoming entrance hall and a spacious lounge which overlooks the delightful west facing rear garden. There are two further reception rooms which would be ideally used as a Large study and a further family room ideal for the kids! Integrated tv media points are at various points downstairs as well as all the upstairs bedrooms. There is a spacious and well appointed/tasteful kitchen area, which has several integrated appliances, solid wood work surfaces, a large breakfast bar and ample space for a dining table to be used as a kitchen/dining room. There is also a downstairs shower room and a utility area. The ground floor is predominantly Karndean flooring throughout. The first floor has a master bedroom suite with a luxury en suite shower room. Bedrooms two and three feature dressing room/wardrobe areas and bedroom four offers a further spacious double bedroom. Finally, to the first floor there is a further luxury bathroom. Outside there is a lovely, sunny, westerly facing rear garden - a real feature of the property which also has a full width indian sandstone patio area. There is an attached garage and ample block paved parking to the front. Bickley and Chislehurst stations can be found a short distance away making the property ideal for the commuter. Bromley Town centre provides excellent shopping entertainment and commercial facilities. listing.letting_fees:
Once we have agreed terms for a tenancy, we will require payment of a non-refundable £175 tenancy administration fee per tenant (each adult to be resident in the property), covering all referencing, preparation of the tenancy agreement and associated administration relating to commencement of tenancy, together with a £200 reservation fee which will be credited to your initial rental on commencement of tenancy

A deposit will be due on commencement of tenancy, calculated at 125% (1 & 1/4 times) the monthly rent, unless an additional amount is agreed, for example in relation to pets. This is to be held for the duration of tenancy and from which deduction may be made based on the findings of the inventory check-out or otherwise in respect of breach of contract.

A landlord will normally pay to have an inventory prepared and checked on commencement of tenancy, whilst a tenant will normally pay for an inventory check-out on termination of tenancy, currently typically between £70 - £110 dependent on size of property and subject to change over time.

We currently charge tenants £60 to prepare a tenancy agreement on renewal of tenancy, usually annually. This is subject to change over time.
listing.description: Ripley Close can be found in a charming and popular development within 0.7 miles of Bickley station as well as having access to Chislehurst and Petts Wood mainline stations which serve an array of London termini.The hallway gives access to all other rooms. The dining room has twin, glazed doors which lead to the spacious lounge. The lounge overlooks and gives access to the garden. In addition there is a study, cloakroom and fitted kitchen with integrated appliances. Access to the tandem garage can be gained from the kitchen as well as from the rear garden.To the first floor are four double bedrooms, all with fitted wardrobes or built in storage space. The master benefits from a modern en suite shower room with power shower. There is also a family bathroom, again with power shower.The rear of the property is southerly facing and mainly laid to lawn, but also includes a large patio area. To the front is off street parking as well as access to the tandem garage.Internal viewing is essential to fully appreciate all that this four bedroom detached home has to offer.

listing.description: Water’s edge, keston ponds - luxury apartments by millgate launching Saturday 4th & Sunday 5th March 2017A collection of 13 one and two bedroom luxury apartments set within two beautifully restored buildings.Water’s Edge comprises thirteen luxurious and perfectly proportioned apartments nestled in the Keston countryside within easy reach of transport links. Two striking buildings, Forest Lodge, an imposing 19th manor house, and Alder House, a grand red brick building, have been fastidiously converted by award winning developers Millgate to create this collection of highly specified apartments all enjoying use of the beautiful, landscaped grounds and woodland surroundings. Each apartment is unique in its design and layout yet all offer spacious, well-proportioned rooms, highly specified, fully integrated kitchens, generous receptions, bedrooms with a range of fitted wardrobes, and luxurious bathrooms. Some apartments further benefit from a private terrace or patio, whilst off-street parking is provided to each apartment.Specification highlights include:• Hand painted Shaker style kitchens with soft close cabinets, stone worktops, wine coolers and integrated Siemens appliances• Utility cupboard with stacked Siemens washing machine & condenser tumble dryer• Ceramic & porcelain tiled bathrooms and en suites with stone worktops, Villeroy & Boch sanitaryware, full width mirrors and underfloor heating• Wood flooring to living areas and luxury carpet to all bedrooms• Bespoke cabinetry and wardrobes to all bedrooms• Colour video entry door system• Off-street parking and secure cycle storeLocationWater’s Edge, in the heart of Keston’s beautiful countryside, is perfectly located to enjoy the tranquillity of the parks, lakes and commons yet just a short walk to the local shops and amenities. Embrace village life at Keston’s two highly regarded pubs, The Fox and The Greyhound, or enjoy exquisite fine dining at critically acclaimed Chapter One, less than a mile away. Neighbouring Locksbottom Village provides a large range of shopping facilities including a Sainsbury’s superstore along with a good selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Central London is easily accessible by rail with direct trains to Victoria from Bromley South; a direct stopping service to Charing Cross, St. Pancras International and Victoria from Orpington Station; and a service to London Bridge, Waterloo East & Charing Cross from Hayes Station, located just 1.9 miles from Water’s Edge.The local school, Keston CoE Primary, has been rated ‘Outstanding’ by Ofsted, as have both nearby Grammar Schools, Newstead Woods & St. Olave’s.First phase pricing from £395,000 - £750,000please contact us to book your appointment for the launch event.All images are computer generated or of previous Millgate schemes.Leasehold

listing.description: We are delighted to offer for sale this attractive three/four bedroom detached character cottage style property located in a popular road on the outskirts of Keston. The property benefits from an extensive ground floor including lounge, dining room, cottage style kitchen, study/bedroom four with en suite shower room plus an additional family bathroom. There are three good sized bedrooms to the first floor, all benefitting from enviable views over the large and attractive garden to rear with views over fields beyond. We strongly recommend your early viewing.Entrance Door Opening toEntrance Lobby Double glazed window to front, understairs storage cupboard, double radiator, laminate flooring, opening to:Dining Room Double glazed bay window with beautiful views over garden and surrounding locality to rear, double radiator, laminate flooring, staircase with balustrade leading to first floor, double glazed window to frontLiving Room Feature Victoriana style fireplace to centre of room with open fire and surround, laminate flooring, double radiator, double glazed bow window to front and further double glazed double doors providing attractive views and access to garden to rear, multi paned door opening to:Study/Bedroom Four Double glazed window to front, exposed wooden floorboards, Velux window and door to :En Suite Shower Room Enclosed corner shower cubicle with Triton electric shower unit, corner wash hand basin with mixer tap and tiled splashback, low level WC, half tiling to walls, opaque double glazed window to rearKitchen A range of matching shaker style wall and base mounted units with wooden work surfaces and inset circular sink unit with circular drainer, five ring gas hob including wok burner, stainless steel extractor hood, eye level Stoves double oven, built-in breakfasting bar with space for low mounted fridge and freezer, laminate flooring, part tiling to walls, glass display cabinet, ceiling spotlights, part panelling to walls, double glazed window with scenic views over garden to rear and beyond, part leaded door opening to:Covered Porchway With inset single bowl sink unit, with substantial work surfaces, space and plumbing for washing machine and dishwasher, two double glazed barn style doors opening to front and to rearFamily Bathroom Four piece suite comprising; bath with Victorian style mixer tap and hand held shower, corner enclosed shower cubicle with traditional style overhead shower fitting, pedestal wash hand basin, low level WC, half tiling to walls with mosaic tiled border, ladder style radiator, opaque double glazed windows to front, shaver pointLanding Hatch opening to loft area, two double glazed windows to frontMaster Bedroom Built-in cupboard with further low mounted cupboard to either side, wash hand basin with mixer tap, triple aspect double glazed windows with attractive views to rear, front and to sideBedroom Two Dual aspect double glazed windows to front and with enviable views over garden to rear, single radiatorBedroom Three Double glazed window with attractive views over garden to rear, single radiator, laminate flooringRear Garden Paved patio area with hard standing with seating area, garden laid mainly to lawn with a plenitude of flower, shrub and herbaceous borders with some mature trees, greenhouse set to rear with vegetable garden, brick built shed, mature apple tree with beautiful views over fields beyond

listing.description: Apartment 11 is a highly desirable apartment with large windows surrounding the open plan kitchen/living/dining room which permits natural light and offers views out towards the landscaped gardens. The oak herringbone flooring is another enviable feature which is fitted from the hallway through to the kitchen/living/dining room.The luxuriously chic kitchen includes a Siemens integrated induction hob, a single oven and combination microwave, along with a fridge/freezer and dishwasher. Beautiful Silestone worktops and splashbacks plus under-unit lighting, complete it’s luxury feel. The kitchen also features an island unit, making it the perfect open plan space for entertaining.The master suite boasts a large dressing room with fitted wardrobes and en suite with a contemporary bath. Both bedrooms are luxuriously carpeted. The second bedroom also has an en suite with a shower completed with porcelain tiles to the floor and walls.With 1249 sq ft of elegant carefully considered space, this apartment offers options for all aspects of modern living - from formal entertaining, through to practical day to day living, all with an elegant touch.Belgrave House is a contemporary and impressive building, both practical and full of character, in a highly desirable location. Peaceful and secluded, within 6 acres of beautiful landscaped gardens, this home is as pleasing to the eye as it is to your lifestyle. The LocationLondon Square Hayes, BR2 is set within extensive private grounds, bordered by mature trees and a listed perimeter wall. Through the securing gates and down a peaceful country lane, it is just a ten minute walk from the old village. Here you will find local shops, amenities and The George public house, while ten minutes walk in the other direction brings you to Hayes Station and the main shopping area, including the bank, a small supermarket and a number of restaurants and cafes. Parents will appreciate the excellent provision of local schools for all ages, both in the state and private sector. The schools in the area are a major factor in attracting and retaining residents in this part of Kent.For many people, the superb transport links are perhaps the main advantage of London Square Hayes, BR2 as a place to live. For commuting to London, you are spoilt for choice, with a choice of trains to different London stations, including Waterloo East, Charing Cross and Victoria. From Hayes Station, half a mile from your doorstep, trains run every ten minutes - London Bridge, for connections to the Tube network, is 36 minutes away. For a quicker train journey, a two mile drive to Bromley South station cuts the train journey to 16 minutes. There are good bus services to Bromley, Croydon and throughout the area, while the A21 and the A24 are both close at hand. The M25 is just 7 miles away, and Gatwick Airport just 23 miles.The immediate neighbourhood around London Square Hayes, BR2 is an active, welcoming community. There is a host of local clubs and societies, including horticulture, drama, film-making, flower arranging, tennis, cricket - even a Symphony Orchestra and Philharmonic Choir. For keeping fit, there are the 79 acres of Hayes Common for walking and cycling, and a choice of gyms and health clubs in Hayes and nearby Bromley.The wider area is a joy to explore, with the whole of the Garden of England within reach. The Kent Downs, an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, stretch down to the coast at Dover and Folkestone, dotted with pretty villages and famous houses and gardens to visit, including Winston Churchill's family home at Chartwell, and Charles Darwin's Down House, preserved as it was when the great scientist lived and studied there.And of course days out in London, or even an evening at a West End show, are fast and simple by train. For shopping, concerts, sporting events, exhibitions or just strolling, you can be there and back in less than an hour.Altogether, a luxuriously classic lifestyle awaits you at London Square Hayes, BR2.Images depict the Belgrave House Show Apartment at London Square Hayes BR2 and are indicative only. Travel times are sourced from National Rail/Google Maps/Citymapper. All journey times and distances are approximate.
listing.short_description: Apartment 11 is located on the first floor within Belgrave House, a Grade II listed country home, featuring an impressive open plan kitchen/living/dining room and offering 1249 sq ft of luxurious living space with two double bedrooms and two en suites

listing.description: Located within just a few minutes walk of Ravensbourne railway station, this immaculately presented 4 Bedroom, Detached family home which has been lovingly maintained and enhanced to an exceptional standard by the current owners.In our opinion this property is the perfect purchase for those looking to raise a family in an established residential area and highly sought after location. The property is ideal for those who may work from home or for those who may care for elderly relatives, such is the volume of living space on offer.Built in the late 60s / early 70s, the current owners have installed and added a number of additional features thereby offering a highly comfortable, functional and contemporary lifestyle to the accommodation. For those with a need to commute, Ravensbourne offers regular services into The City via London Blackfriars. The property is under 15 minutes walk to Shortlands railway station offering further services into the West End via London Victoria.Bromley town centre is just a short drive away with well over 400 retail units to choose from, Bromley is one of the most extensive shopping centres in the region. The intu Shopping Centre boasts over 130 stores alone and Shortlands golf club is also within easy reach.Externally, the property offers a block paved driveway with off street parking for up to 5 vehicles leading to the remote controlled double garage. The property features side access to the well maintained southerly rear garden, laid to lawn with paved patio. This property needs to be viewed internally to be fully appreciated.The Entrance Hall offers integral access to the garage and incorporates storage cupboards with a separate shower room with WC and handbasin. The Dining Room is located to the front of the property with an arched opening to the superbly equipped, contemporary and spacious Kitchen, featuring a range of matching wall and base units, granite worksurfaces, space for appliances and an integrated double oven, induction hob and extractor.The Kitchen also offers access to the garden and together with the shower room features thermostat controlled underfloor heating. The centrepiece of the property is the delightful 22’ approx Living / Family Room, overlooking the garden and featuring a real flame gas fireplace, high grade laminate wood flooring and access to the garden.The first floor features an exceptionally spacious landing with access to the loftspace. With 3 double bedrooms offering a range of fitted furniture, there is also a well proportioned single, currently used as a study. This floor is further complemented by a modern family bathroom with roll top bath.Further features include double glazing, gas central heating and can be offered with ‘ no onward chain ‘ to a buyer with a strict timeframe.Living Room6.09m x 3.92m (20' x 12' 10")Dining Room3.61m x 2.99m (11' 10" x 9' 10")Kitchen3.79m x 3.15m (12' 5" x 10' 4")Bedroom (Master)4.47m x 3.55m (14' 8" x 11' 8")Bedroom 23.71m x 3.53m (12' 2" x 11' 7")Bedroom 33.91m x 2.44m (12' 10" x 8')Bedroom 43.16m x 2.45m (10' 4" x 8')Bathroom2.55m x 1.78m (8' 4" x 5' 10")Shower Room2.25m x 1.14m (7' 5" x 3' 9")Garage5.24m x 4.50m (17' 2" x 14' 9")

listing.description: We are delighted to offer for sale this three (formerly four) bedroom detached house located in a cul-de-sac within the heart of Keston Village.The accommodation which has been extended by its current owners features a ground floor comprising of a modern kitchen leading to dining area, spacious lounge, study and cloakroom.The first floor now features a master bedroom suite including walk in dressing room, (formerly bedroom four) plus en suite shower room. There are two further bedrooms plus four piece contemporary family bathroom. There is a private rear garden, plus driveway to front with parking for a number of vehicles. Viewing highly recommended.

listing.description: An immaculate three/ four bedroom newly extended and refurbished house about 0.7 miles to 'outstanding' rated Pickhurst and Hayes Secondary School (within the 2016 catchment area) and c. 0.7 miles to Hayes station this is an ideal family home where on viewing you can appreciate the design, specification, quality and standard of finish.The property has a welcoming entrance hall with solid wood flooring leading to a 23' magnificent kitchen/breakfast room with under floor heating, Porcelanosa floor tiles and contemporary bi-folding doors opening onto the good size westerly rear garden. A lantern glass roof is another real feature of the kitchen along with the solid wood units, range cooker, wine cooler, central island, display lights and natural quartz worktop creating a stunning room. Double doors from the dining area lead into the beautifully presented living room featuring a stone fireplace and gas fire. A good size utility/cloakroom and downstairs study/bedroom 4 with fitted wardrobe complete the ground floor accommodation. To the first floor there are three double bedrooms all having the benefit of fitted wardrobes, the master having a dressing area with fitted wardrobes and an en-suite shower wet room with Villeroy and Boch suite. The main bathroom features Porcelanosa floor and wall tiles, a bath and a shower wet room.Located about a 10-15 minute walk to Hayes Village where you will find a good range of shops, restaurants, coffee shops and pubs along with Hayes station where London commuters will benefit from direct services to Charing Cross and Cannon Street. Bromley South station is less than a 10 minute bus journey for trains to London Victoria from 15 minutes and direct services to St Pancras International. The area also benefits from many local open spaces including Pickhurst Park, Norman Park and Husseywell Park along with sports facilities such as Nuffield Health Fitness & Wellbeing Gym, Bromley Football Club and Norman Park athletics track. Distances and times are approximate. Please note the owner of this property is connected to jdm.

The property is approximately 15 minutes walk to Shortlands railway station offering further services into the West End via London Victoria.The property is also located just yards from the 354 bus route, serving Central Bromley and Beckenham Town Centre. Bromley town centre is just a short drive away with well over 400 retail units to choose from, Bromley is one of the most extensive shopping centres in the region. The intu Shopping Centre boasts over 130 stores alone and Shortlands golf club is also within easy reach.In our opinion this property is the perfect purchase for those with a young family or those looking to start a family in an established residential area and highly sought after location. The property is also ideal for those who may work from home or for those who may care for elderly relatives, such is the volume of living space on offer.The accommodation has been lovingly enhanced and modernised to a high standard by the current owners and is offered to the market in very good condition, whilst retaining much of the charm and character associated with properties of this era, including original oak flooring and internal doors and has been skilfully blended with an array of contemporary themes. Externally, the property features a shared shingle driveway with off street parking for 3 vehicles leading to the garage.The rear garden features a wide variety of shrubs set within shaped borders and lawn, a rockery, timber decked patio and childrens play area which needs to be viewed to be fully appreciated and to absorb the time and effort the current owners have invested in the outside space.With side access leading to the Entrance Hall with oak wood flooring and cloak cupboard the property flows beautifully throughout. With a larger than average Living room and Dining Room overlooking the rear garden, the ground floor is further complemented with a fully equipped Kitchen.The first floor features 3 exceptionally well proportioned bedrooms together with a contemporary bathroom suite. The landing provides access to the sun roof via ladder and the garden features a very unique ‘Anderson’ shelter.Further features include, gas central heating, double glazing and feature real flame, gas fireplace.Living Room6.21m x 4.31m (20' 4" x 14' 2")Dining Room4.12m x 3.80m (13' 6" x 12' 6")Kitchen2.77m x 2.53m (9' 1" x 8' 4")Bedroom (Master)4.25m x 3.95m (13' 11" x 13')Bedroom 23.80m x 3.77m (12' 6" x 12' 4")Bedroom 32.79m x 2.57m (9' 2" x 8' 5")Bathroom2.40m x 1.51m (7' 10" x 4' 11")

listing.description: This chain free, extended, three bedroom detached house is situated in a pleasant residential road away from through traffic and an easy walk from Ravenswood School for Boys and local bus routes to Bromley, Hayes and Orpington with their rail links to London. Local shops are available at Bromley Common and Locksbottom with two supermarkets as well as pubs and restaurants.The property has been in the same ownership for 47 years and, though requiring updating and some modernisation, this is an opportunity to create a charming family home. The accommodation comprises entrance lobby leading to reception hall, with parquet flooring and cloakroom with two piece white suite. The parquet flooring extends to the living room with fitted gas fire (currently disconnected). There is a separate dining room with patio doors to the garden. The kitchen is l-shaped and has a range of base and wall units with oak doors and there is an integrated four ring gas hob, double oven and grill. An archway leads to what could be the breakfasting area and is currently providing space and services for a washing machine and fridge/freezer.To the first floor, there are two double bedrooms. The master bedroom has an extensive range of fitted units providing storage over the bed area, bedside units, wardrobe and dressing table. The third bedroom is a generous single. The tiled, family shower room has a large corner shower, wash basin and WC.Outside, the rear garden of westerly aspect is of a size that can be easily maintained. Laid to lawn with a mixed border, there is a timber shed and greenhouse and to the side a single garage with power and light and a workshop area at the far end. The paved drive will accommodate four to five cars and the front garden is laid to lawn with a shrubbery border.

listing.description: Located just a short stroll from Bromley South and The Glades, this delightful, 3 bedroom, linked, Semi Detached period property, offered with no onward chain, which has been the subject of loving improvement and care by the current owners.Ideally located for the commuter, Bromley South offers regular, fast rail services into Central London and the West End via London Victoria, The City via London Blackfriars and Farringdon.In our opinion, this property makes for an ideal purchase to the first or second time buyer or for those with or contemplating, starting a family.Bromley Town Centre offers one of the most comprehensive range of shops, retail units, restaurants and leisure facilities in the region and for fitness enthusiasts, Virgin Active, Nuffield Leisure and Spa and The Pavilion Leisure Centre, are all within easy reach. Local greenspace can be found at Norman Park.The property is within access of a number of local Primary Schools including, Raglan, St Marks, Ashgrove, Highfield and Harris Academy together with reputable nurseries and pre schools, most notably, Bishop Challoner. Ravensbourne Secondary is within walking distance and Hayes School is just a short bus ride away.This unique property must be viewed to be appreciated and whilst retaining all of the charm and character of properties from this era, it has been lovingly enhanced with Art Deco, Retro and Mediterranean themes and is presented in excellent order, requiring little or no redecoration.With side access leading to a mosaic tiled lobby, the ground floor features a Living Room with bay window to the front and includes ornate cornicing and a feature fireplace. The Dining Room, again, with feature fireplace flows through into the spacious, 'retro’ styled Kitchen with some integrated appliances and an extensive range of matching wall and base units. A Mediterranean styled Conservatory with tiled floor and double doors, complements the ground floor and leads to the 70' approx. Rear garden.The first floor incorporates 2 double bedrooms and a well proportioned single with delightful family bathroom which includes a Jacuzzi corner bath, a separate shower cubicle, Amtico flooring and Italian marble tiles.The property offers direct access to an exceptionally spacious drive-through garage and ideal for the diy/Car/Motorbike enthusiast or for those requiring a studio workshop.Externally, the property offers off street parking to the front and is further enhanced by a fully functional and extensive workshop at the rear of the garden which must be seen to be fully appreciated.Further features include double glazing and gas central heating.All prospective purchasers are strongly advised to view immediately to avoid disappointment.Living Room3.67m x 3.35m (12' x 11')Dining Room3.95m x 3.70m (13' x 12' 2")Kitchen3.70m x 3.09m (12' 2" x 10' 2")Bedroom (Master)3.76m x 3.37m (12' 4" x 11' 1")Bedroom 23.72m x 3.18m (12' 2" x 10' 5")Bedroom 33.41m x 2.82m (11' 2" x 9' 3")Bathroom3.03m x 2.49m (9' 11" x 8' 2")Conservatory3.15m x 2.58m (10' 4" x 8' 6")Workshop6.00m x 6.00m (19' 8" x 19' 8")Garage6.97m x 3.73m (22' 10" x 12' 3")

listing.description: Offered chain free. This very well presented, extended three bedroom semi detached house, in a cul-de-sac of similar properties, is ideally located for Ravenswood Secondary School, transport links to Bromley South Station and local primary schools such as Raglan and Trinity C of E Primary School.The accommodation comprises entrance hall leading to living/dining room. The kitchen forms part of the extension with white glossy units, a New World stainless steel range cooker and integrated fridge/freezer with french doors out onto the southerly facing garden. There is a downstairs cloakroom and another room which is currently used as a utility/salon, ideal for someone wishing to run a beauty business from home but could easily be used as a study/playroom. Upstairs, there are two double bedrooms and a single all with built-in cupboards and a good sized family bathroom.To the rear of the property is the secluded, southerly facing garden measuring approximately 50' in length. There is a decked patio area from the house and to the rear of the garden a barbeque gazebo area. The single detached garage with power is to the side/rear of the property. There is a lawn to the front and a driveway that can accommodate up to four cars. Viewing comes highly recommended.

listing.description: Oieo £500,000This well presented, bay fronted, three bed semi detached is situated towards the closed end of a pleasant cul-de-sac facing an attractive green. A short walk from shops at Bromley Common, the nearest schools are Trinity C of E Primary and Bishop Justus Secondary. Other schools in the area include Ravenswood School for Boys and Darrick Wood. Bus routes connecting to Bromley and Orpington with their mainline stations pass along the A21.The accommodation has been well maintained by the vendors and comprises an enclosed porch and entrance hall leading to the living room. The open plan kitchen/diner has space for a large dining table and the fitted kitchen has a good range of units with lighting over the worktops and downlighting. There is a five ring stainless steel gas hob with hood over and matching under oven, the large American style fridge/freezer, Bosch dishwasher and washing machine may be available by separate negotiation. From the double glazed conservatory, there are doors leading to the delightful, lawned rear garden, measuring 70' x 22', with its paved terrace and two garden sheds that will remain.To the first floor, there are two double bedrooms, the third being a single with fitted wardrobes. The spacious family bathroom has a four piece white suite comprising panelled bath, enclosed shower, WC and vanity wash basin. Chrome heated towel rail.There is parking on the drive for two cars and unrestricted parking in the street. Viewing is highly recommended.

listing.description: Located just minutes from Shortlands Village and Railway Station, this superbly presented, 3 double Bedroom, 3 Bathroom, Victorian Mid Terraced House which has been enhanced and maintained to an exceptional standard by the current owners and retains all of the charm associated with properties of this era.Decorated in neutral themes throughout, this bright, airy and spacious property makes for an ideal purchase to those with a growing or established family or for those who may work from home, such is the volume of living space on offer.For those with a need to commute the property is ideally located, just a couple of hundred yards from Shortlands station offering regular peak time services to Central London and the West End via London Victoria and The City via London Blackfriars and Thameslink.For those with young children, the property is just a few minutes walk from the excellent Valley Primary School and recently opened Harris Academy on Queen Anne Avenue and is within reach of a number of other notable schools.Bromley and Beckenham Town Centres are within a 10 minute drive. With well over 400 retail units to choose from, Bromley is one of the most extensive shopping centres in the region. The intu Shopping Centre boasts over 130 stores alone. Bromley South is currently part of a regeneration programme at St Marks Square offering a new brand of leisure and dining units including a new cinema complex.This property is set over 3 floors and features 2 well proportioned Reception Rooms together with a well equipped Kitchen a Bathroom to the ground floor. The first floor features a Master Bedroom together with another very spacious 2nd Bedroom and family Bathroom.The second floor has been extended to incorporate a further double Bedroom with ensuite shower room. To the front the property has a block paved driveway with off street parking.To the rear the property offers a suntrapped, south westerly facing rear garden with patio, lawn and borders with mature shrubs. Further features include Gas Central Heating and Double Glazing.In our opinion, this is a prime opportunity to acquire a stylish and highly desirable family home, located in a sought after location and interest is expected to be significant and immediate.Living Room4.34m x 3.41m (14' 3" x 11' 2")Dining Room4.34m x 2.47m (14' 3" x 8' 1")Kitchen2.94m x 2.38m (9' 8" x 7' 10")Bedroom (Master)4.90m x 4.18m (16' 1" x 13' 9")En Suite1.66m x 1.26m (5' 5" x 4' 2")Bedroom 24.79m x 2.45m (15' 9" x 8')Bedroom 34.39m x 3.32m (14' 5" x 10' 11")Bathroom2.16m x 1.72m (7' 1" x 5' 8")Bathroom 21.75m x 1.65m (5' 9" x 5' 5")

listing.letting_fees:
Once we have agreed terms for a tenancy, we will require payment of a non-refundable £175 tenancy administration fee per tenant (each adult to be resident in the property), covering all referencing, preparation of the tenancy agreement and associated administration relating to commencement of tenancy, together with a £200 reservation fee which will be credited to your initial rental on commencement of tenancy

A deposit will be due on commencement of tenancy, calculated at 125% (1 & 1/4 times) the monthly rent, unless an additional amount is agreed, for example in relation to pets. This is to be held for the duration of tenancy and from which deduction may be made based on the findings of the inventory check-out or otherwise in respect of breach of contract.

A landlord will normally pay to have an inventory prepared and checked on commencement of tenancy, whilst a tenant will normally pay for an inventory check-out on termination of tenancy, currently typically between £70 - £110 dependent on size of property and subject to change over time.

We currently charge tenants £60 to prepare a tenancy agreement on renewal of tenancy, usually annually. This is subject to change over time.
